title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" and involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" requires the President to determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" mandates the President to assess if foreign financial institutions have facilitated significant transactions for specific individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. Certifications of determinations regarding foreign financial institutions, including Iranian ones, must be transmitted to congressional committees. The certifications should be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant as per the section's guidelines. The determination of significant transactions and financial services is based on guidelines outlined in section 561.404 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. DETERMINATION AND CERTIFICATION OF WHETHER CERTAIN FOREIGN PERSONS HAVE SUPPORTED COVERED PERSONS. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The determination must be submitted in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. A covered person in this section includes an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under Executive Orders 13224 or 13382. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property of persons in connection with the national emergency with respect to Syria, including orders targeting human rights abuses and senior officials of the Government of Syria. The curr_chunk includes Executive Orders targeting property blocking and transactions with Syria and Iran, as well as suspending entry into the United States for certain individuals related to human rights abuses. The curr_chunk involves Executive Orders blocking property and entry into the US for individuals linked to human rights abuses by the governments of Iran and Syria. The curr_chunk involves blocking property linked to Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps or its affiliates under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, "appropriate congressional committees" refers to committees as defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. "Foreign financial institution" is defined in title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. "Foreign person" includes natural persons who are not U.S. persons, as well as corporations and partnerships. A foreign person is defined as a natural person, corporation, partnership, or entity that is not a United States person, or an individual working on behalf of a foreign government. This definition excludes foreign financial institutions. The term "foreign terrorist organization" refers to any organization designated as such by the Secretary of State. The term "Iranian financial institution" is defined in the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010. The term "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" refers to the agreement made in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, along with the European Union, regarding Iran's nuclear program. The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, along with related agreements, was transmitted to Congress on July 19, 2015, as per the Atomic Energy Act of 1954. The terms "person" and "United States person" are defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. The term "United States person" is defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 (Public Law 104-172; 50 U.S.C. 1701 note).
